jobDescription: From image capture to situational understanding, SRI’s Center for Vision Technologies offers end-to-end vision solutions that translate into real-world applications. Our scientists pioneered real-time, real-world computer vision with the early development of pyramid/wavelet processing that enabled analysis with unprecedented speed and precision. They continue today with a broad array of advances in visual navigation, 3D scene modeling, and object and activity recognition. Responsibilities of the position include:Lead and participate in the development of algorithms, software and systems for object recognition, event/activity modeling and recognition, video analysis for modeling and recognition.Develop algorithms, software and applications in areas such as Visual Security & Surveillance, Autonomous Robotics, Video Data Mining.Ability to provide technical lead with innovative ideas and algorithms.Work effectively in a team to achieve the goals of projects and deliver software and systems to external clients.Write proposals, work as a team to actively seek funding from various government and commercial agencies.Maintain and enhance visibility at the individual, group and company level amongst worldwide academic, research and commercial institutions.Give technical and business presentations to external clients, academic and government/industry audiences and to internal staff and management.MS/PhD in Computer Science/Electrical Engineering or related fields with a focus on Computer Vision. Emerging talent welcome to apply.Experience in creating and executing on projects funded by external agencies such as DARPA, ONR, AFRL, DHS, DTO and other government R&D; and commercial agencies is preferred.Ability to lead projects and people, as well as skills to work as a part of a team to achieve technical and project goals.Technical excellence, leadership and proven track record in: Object and event recognition algorithms, software and systems.Video motion analysis for tracking, classification and analysis.General Computer Vision algorithms.Real-time systems for video analysis and understanding.Applications areas such as Security & Surveillance, Autonomous Robotics, Video Databases.Desired Qualifications:U.S. Citizenship/Permanent Residency is preferred, clearance is a plus. Exceptional candidates in non-immigrant status will be considered.
